MS MCQs

    Virtualize memory - Memory overcommitment

    »

    1. Memory overcommitment implies that:

      The combined total size of the real memories equals the size of the physical memory.

      The combined total size of the real memories is less than the size of the physical memory.

      The combined total size of the real memories is greater than the size of the physical memory.


    2. Assume a hypervisor does not employ memory overcommitment. Assume also a physical memory of 9 GB. What is the maximum number of virtual machines that can be provisioned on such a hypervisor if the real memory of each VM should be at least 3 GB?

      1 VM

      2 VMs

      3 VMs

      4 VMs

      As many VMs as we like


    3. Assume a hypervisor employs memory overcommitment. To avoid information leaking among virtual machines during page reclamations, the hypervisor will:

      Reclaim pages that haven’t been previously used by any VM.

      Avoid reclaiming pages.

      Erase every reclaimed page irrespective of whether it’s been used previously.
